Race.SpecificTitle: Alderman -- District B, Town of Farmerville
Alderman -- District D, Town of Farmerville
PW Prop. No. 1 -- 5.13 Mills Renewal - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Union, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a five and thirteen hundredths (5.13) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $779,760 reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, both years inclusive, with the revenues therefrom to be used for the purpose of construction and improvement of public roads and bridges throughout Union Parish, Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Prop. No. 2 -- 6.15 Mills Renewal - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Union, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a six and fifteen hundredths (6.15) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $934,800 reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, both years inclusive, with the revenues therefrom to be used for the purpose of maintenance of public roads and bridges throughout Union Parish, Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Prop. No. 3 -- 2.40 Mills Renewal - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Union, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a two and forty hundredths (2.40) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $364,800 reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, both years inclusive, with the revenues therefrom to be used for the operation and maintenance of the Union Parish Public Library?

Race.SpecificTitle: Farmerville Area FPD (Prop. Tax Cont.) -- 6 Mills Continuation - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Farmerville Area Fire Protection District Propositions
(Property Tax Continuation)
Race.FullText: Shall the Farmerville Area Fire Protection District of Union Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), under Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, the applicable provisions of Chapter 5, Chapter 6-A and Chapter 6-B of Title 18 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect a special ad valorem tax of six (6.00) mills (the "Tax"), on all the property subject to taxation within the District, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2018 and ending with the year 2027, collections from the Tax for the first year expected to be approximately $162,431.47, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating fire protection facilities, vehicles and equipment, including both movable and immovable property, that are to be used to provide fire protection in the District; provided that the District shall not be authorized to levy the Tax unless the following annual service charge proposition is approved by the electorate, and for authority to fund a portion of the avails of the Tax into Bonds in the manner provided by law?

Race.SpecificTitle: Farmerville Area FPD (Serv. Chg. Cont.) -- $50 Serv. Chg. Continuation - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Farmerville Area Fire Protection District Propositions
(Service Charge Continuation)
Race.FullText: In the event of the passage of the foregoing millage proposition, shall the Farmerville Area Fire Protection District of Union Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), acting under the authority of La. R.S. 40:1502.1 and other constitutional and statutory authority, levy and collect an annual service charge of Fifty Dollars ($50.00) (the "Service Charge") on each residential or commercial structure located wholly or partly in the District, whether occupied or unoccupied, for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2018 and ending with the year 2027 (an estimated $103,050 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), inclusive, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating fire protection facilities, vehicles and equipment, including both movable and immovable property, that are to be used to provide fire protection in the District?
